frameDefinitions: An Agent, which may be an individual or group, is engaged in a complex Activity.
This frame describes a complex event which lasts some amount of time, consisting of a beginning stage, a stage where the process is ongoing, and a finish or end.
An Entity is affected by an Event.
A Cause, animate or inanimate, causes a process, the Effect, to begin.
A stretch of linguistic discourse or a Text that a Communicator produces has a Topic that it is about.

A Theme changes location with respect to a salient location, which can be expressed by a Source, Path, Goal, Area, Direction, Path_shape, or Distance, as shown in the examples below: ''  'Start your ascent from Achintree Farm in Glen Nevis.'
frameExamples: The New Car Assessment <t>Program</t> (NCAP) is dedicated to helping the public buy a safer car.
I'm in the <t>process</t> of writing it down.
The hotel is <t>undergoing</t> renovations at this time.
The murder of Sergei Kirov <t>set off</t> a chain of events that culminated in the Great Terror of the 1930s.
Start your <t>ascent</t> from Achintree Farm in Glen Nevis.
listRoleDefinitions: The individual or organization that carries out the project.
An area of human endeavor, typically scientifc in nature, in which the <fen>Agent</fen>'s <fen>Activity</fen> falls.
What the <fen>Agent</fen> (an individual or the members of an organization) are dedicated to doing.
The larger aim that the <fen>Agent</fen> is pursuing by carrying out certain coordinated measures.
An entity (abstract or concrete) which is involved in an implicit <fen>Activity</fen>.
The ongoing plan of action which allows the <fen>Agent</fen> to pursue the <fen>Activity</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Project</fen> is ongoing.
The location where a <fen>Project</fen> is pursued.
Name of the Process which occurs.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The thing which is affected by the Event.
A change in the world which affects the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Entity</fen> undergoes the <fen>Event</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Entity</fen> undergoes the <fen>Event</fen>.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>s.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the process that the <fen>Cause</fen> initiates.
This role is for the <fen>Time</fen>  when causing to start occurs
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Effect</fen> occurs.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is what a <fen>Text</fen> is about.
A set of propositions that is coherent in being about a <fen>Topic</fen>
The <fen>Communicator</fen> is the person who has produced a <fen>Text</fen> on a <fen>Topic</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Communicator</fen> produces <fen>Text</fen> on a <fen>Topic</fen>.

This is the object which moves. In many sentences this role will be expressed as something which moves under its own power. However, this role is not <ment>required</ment> to be an animate mover, so it is different from Self_mover.

Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Source</fen>. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. In particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen> (see below) expresses the frame element <fen>Path</fen>, including directional expressions:
Any expression which tells where the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up as a result of the motion expresses the frame element Goal.
Any expression which characterizes the extent of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Distance</fen>.
This frame element is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path.
The configuration formed by the entire <fen>Path</fen> of the <fen>Theme</fen>, taken simultaneously.
The direction in which the <fen>Theme</fen> goes.
The time at which the motion takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the motion (which is specified by a <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>) is located.
listRoleExamples: The <fex>DOE</fex> Human Genome Program also has developed high-throughput approaches to identifying is-regulatory sequences in the human and other genomes
Several projects <fex>in computational linguistics</fex> have recently stalled due to lack of funding .
The <fex>New Car Assessment</fex> Program (NCAP) is dedicated to helping the public buy a safer car.
The program <fex>to analyze the composition of Titan's sludge</fex> is nearly complete.
Iran has vowed to continue its <fex>nuclear</fex> program and is demanding that sanctions against it should be lifted .
Few things spark <fex>the wrath of the British</fex> like food additives.
<fex>In Obscurania</fex>, the release of the movie sparked protests.
In his book, <fex>Smithers</fex> discusses cotton production.
The cat crossed the street <fex>from her yard</fex>.
The children hopped <fex>into the neighbor's yard</fex>.
I leaped <fex>twenty feet</fex> before slipping and falling.
The frogs jumped <fex>down</fex> through the meadow.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Federal Electronic and Information Technology Accessibility and Compliance Act
